quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Sugar and Science
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, nowadays, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is the inventor of Tupperware?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earl Tupper

questions.question: Overconsumption of sugar causes hyperactivity in children, manifested by increased movement, impulsiveness, distractibility, and mood swings.
What actress played the role of a transgender man in the movie Boys Dont Cry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hilary Swank

questions.question: Making sugar by evaporating cane juice was developed in about 500 BC, in what country?
Brown sugar, a type of unrefined or partially refined soft sugar, generally has a lower caloric value than white sugar.
What happens to a goldfish when it is kept in the dark?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It turns a paler color.

questions.question: Nowadays, sugar is used in science and manufacturing as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the largest country by area in Africa?
Sugar, a naturally occurring nutrient that makes food taste sweet, is classified in chemistry as what?
Apart from its culinary properties, sugar has many uses in science and manufacturing. It is used for all of the following, except one.

options.text: To tan leather, printer inks and dyes.
To increase ice creams freezing point

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To increase ice creams freezing point

questions.question: Sugar is important for the proper function of which of these bodily systems?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nervous system

questions.question: Which of the following materials is the densest?
Lactose is a type of sugar consisting of two subunits (galactose and glucose), found primarily in what food?
Scientists have proved that one of the health dangers, which ingesting sugar on a habitual basis involves, is the suppression of the activity of which system of the human body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Immune system

questions.question: Blue litmus paper turns red when it comes in contact with alkalines.

questions.question: The bustard is a frog.

He got paid by the word
That was the style of the day
He didnt want anyone to say Please Sir! More gruel!

options.text: The first  long distance Television image was sent.

The New York Stock Exchange fell 67 points (29% then)
The first Easter Parade in was held in New York  City.
